channel.title: Bleeding + Poison Merge
channel.description:
Right now, whether you are bleeding or poisoned is a pointless distinction that reveals what faction you are against. So I'd suggest a replacement for Nightshade on Assassin that would have basically the same effect.
> Hidden Blade: Cut your target, making them bleed. They will die in 2 days.
In addition, if you heal bleeding or poison the healer/healed person should get the same notification as an attack.

item.title: Bleeding + Poison Merge
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
I am not going to discuss the exact amount of confirmable it is, because that is not the point I am trying to convey. I agree with you that it is confirmable. It is the only kind of confirmable that is desirable and that is at cost to the BD. Mystic and Noble have no costs to proving themselves with their day ability other than losing 1 use of the ability. If you compare Butler poison, Telepathy and forced voting, the clear distinction between them is that Butler poison comes at a risk to the BD. That is probably precisely the reason why the scum counterparts have those day abilities, but not the Butler poison, even though they are helpless if they turn into assassin/CL.

Wolfing to prove is a similar kinda deal.

item.title: Bleeding + Poison Merge
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
Having confirmability at the risk of killing your fellow BD is warranted and frankly the best form of confirmability. This is why the old butler poison also wasn’t too bad honestly. There is a tangible cost to confirming yourself outside of using up a limited use ability, so I don’t think hunter’s wolf needs changing.

item.title: Bleeding + Poison Merge
item.dc:creator: RawkHawk
item.description:
I get what firekitten is saying. Due to the occupy immunity, Hunter is one of the few plausible claims for possessor and sorc. While it’s quickly outed by a second Hunter claim, players also need to be wary of fools claiming Hunter.

Basically, I think I’m in agreement that wolf stays a night ability.

Edit: thinking about it more, having a day wolf reintroduces the old butler trick of “poison the king to prove”. Yeah, sure you could be assassin or cult leader, but cult leaders have never claimed wanted to claim Hunter, and rarely assassins will since they’re both killer. But just the same how a night wolf “confirms” a Hunter, knowing they’re occ immune plus a bleed will “prove” them.
